channel.title: My Smf Simple portal is very slow, but the forums are fast =/
channel.description: Anybody has an idea how this comes? because there are not that much images...

item.title: My Smf Simple portal is very slow, but the forums are fast =/
item.dc:creator: @VorargC VorargC
item.description:
@VorargC wrote:

If anything set the timeout very low, like 1 or 2 seconds.

item.title: My Smf Simple portal is very slow, but the forums are fast =/
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

[quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=603566.msg4224926#msg4224926 date=1360968302]

[quote=“Lastdivine, post:5, topic:485333”][quote author=VorargC link=topic=603566.msg4224776#msg4224776 date=1360958882]

to something like 100? or something
[/quote]Won’t change anything. Your server is just too slow, you should try caching it every 10 minutes or something.[/quote]

nah it is pretty fast, but it only is slow when the server was offline.

item.title: My Smf Simple portal is very slow, but the forums are fast =/
item.dc:creator: @Lastdivine Lastdivine
item.description:
@Lastdivine wrote:

VorargC:

I would personally start disabling blocks one by one to see if you can find out if any of your blocks are causing this.

Thx found out that my Server online/offline php code made it very very very slow.

This was the Code

[code]<?php

$server = “MYSERVERIP”;
$port = “43594”;
$timeout = “10”;

if ($server and $port and $timeout) {
$server1 = @fsockopen("$server", $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
}
if($server1) {
echo “”;
}
else {
echo “”;
}
?>[/code]

I’d prob make that

to something like 100? or something

Read full topic
